int-org-section.heading: Youth and Students

alt-heading.usage: ass casee mena fea sasia eerca
ass casee mena fea sasia eerca

org-entry-head.alt-name: Association des Etats Généraux des Etudiants de l'Europe

org-entry.content-note: promotes cross-border communication, co-operation and integration between students
holds specialized confs
org-entry.stats: mems: 13,000 students in 161 univ. cities in 40 countries

org-entry.found-date: 1948 as Inter­national Association of Students in Economics and Man­agement
org-entry.content-note: provides an international platform for young people to discover and develop their potential; enters into partnerships with selected orgs
compiles a YouthSpeak Survey
org-entry.stats: mems: some 44,000 students in 127 countries and territories

address.verbatim-address: Faculty of Law, Universitas Indonesia, Depok 16424, Indonesia

org-entry.stats: mems: some 14,000 individuals, nat. chapters in 16 states
org-entry.content-note: publ. Asian Journal of Legal Studies
aims to play an integral role in advancing the youth devt agenda and the co-ordination of activities and policies of the Commonwealth with a focus on youth devt
a General Assembly is held every 2 years alongside the Commonwealth Youth Forum

address.verbatim-address: 600 Southborough Dr., Suite 104, South Portland, Maine 04106, USA

org-entry.content-note: issues International Student Identity Card entitling holders to discounts and basic insurance
arranges overseas work and study pro­gs for students
administers progs for teachers and other professionals and sponsors confs on educational exchange
operates a voluntary service prog.
publs The Knowledge Series , Annual Report , occasional papers
aims to foster mutual understanding and promote social responsibility of law students and young lawyers
org-entry.stats: mems: c. 69,000 students and lawyers in around 375 law faculties in 43 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Synergy (2 a year), ELSA Law Review (annually)
represents and advocates for the needs and interests of all young people in Europe
promotes their active participation in democratic processes, as well as understanding and respect for human rights
consults with international orgs and govts on issues relevant to young people

co-sponsors, with the Council of Europe’s European Centre for Global Interdependence and Solidarity, the Spanish Govt, and other partners the University on Youth and Development, a youth event has been convened annually, since 2000, in Mollina, Spain
org-entry.stats: mems: over 100 nat. youth councils and int. non-governmental youth orgs

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association for the Exchange of Students for Technical Experience (IAESTE)

org-entry.content-note: organizes internships and operates an exchange prog. between students and employers
launched a web-based alumni network in 2011
org-entry.stats: mems: 90 nat. cttees and co-operating institutions in 90 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. Annual Review

address.verbatim-address: c/o FDI World Dental Federation, BP 3, 84 ave Louis Casaï, 1216 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.found-date: 1951 to represent dental students and their opinions internationally, to promote exchanges and international congresses
org-entry.stats: mems: 200,000 stu­dents in 50 countries, 15,000 corresponding mems
org-entry.content-note: publ. IADS Newsletter (2 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Medical Students' Associations (IFMSA)

org-entry.content-note: provides forum for capacity building and advocacy opportunities for medical students
maintains 6 standing cttees on professional exchange, research ex­change, medical education, public health, human rights and peace, and reproductive health (including AIDS)
org-entry.stats: mems: 139 nat. orgs

org-entry.found-date: 1979 as the International Federation of Liberal and Radical Youth, present name adopted in 2021
org-entry.content-note: aims to `globalize freedom’, promoting universal human rights, tolerant discrimination-free societies, equal opportunities, and respect for individuals and for minorities; advocates for a market economy that operates within the limits of a fair distribution of wealth and ecological sustainability
in 2023 was conducting 13 programmes, incl. on Africa, the Caucasus, Eastern Europe, Latin America, climate change, dialogue, female leadership, free trade and human rights
holds an annual General Assembly (2023: Bogotá, Colombia, in June)
org-entry.stats: mems: 54 nat. orgs worldwide, and 4 regional orgs (Africa Liberal Youth for Freedom, Arab Youth Union for Freedom and Democracy, Council of Asian Liberals and Democrats Youth, and European Liberal Youth); has 6 observer nat. orgs

address.verbatim-address: 701 13th St, NW, 12th Floor Washington, DC 20005 USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to educate students and lawyers around the world in the principles and purposes of international law, international orgs and institutions, and comparative legal systems
to promote the interests of pharmaceutical students and to encourage international co-operation
org-entry.stats: mems: some 500,000 pharmacy students and recent graduates in 100 countries worldwide
org-entry.content-note: publ. IPSF News Bulletin (annually)

org-entry.found-date: 1907 as Socialist Youth International, present name adopted in 1946
org-entry.content-note: aims to educate young people in the principles of free and democratic socialism and further the co-operation of democratic socialist youth orgs
conducts international meetings and symposia, incl. a biennial world congress (2023: Panamá, Panama, in June, on the theme `The Rise of Populism and Extremism: A Democratic Challenge)
org-entry.stats: mems: 137 full and 27 observer youth and student orgs, structured under an African Cttee, American Cttee, Asia-Pacific Cttee, European Cttee and Mediterranean Cttee
org-entry.content-note: publ. IUSY Newsletter
aims to educate young workers to take on present and future responsibilities in their commitment to the working class, and to gain personal fulfilment through their actions
IYCW Newsletter (monthly)

address.verbatim-address: Franz Josef Str., Haus Mies-van-der-Rohe-Str., 1 Munich 80807, Germany

org-entry.content-note: a global alliance of centre-right political youth orgs
org-entry.stats: mems: 78 nat. orgs worldwide and 9 regional and subregional orgs (the Young Democrat Union of Africa, Americas Young Democrat Union, Caribbean Young Democratic Union, European Young Conservatives, Nordic Conservative Student Union, European Democrat Students, Democratic Youth Community of Europe, Youth of the European People’s Party, Nordic Young Conservative Union)

org-entry.content-note: aims to encourage, to advance international understanding and goodwill, and to solve civic problems by arousing civic consciousness
Junior Chamber orgs throughout the world provide opportunities for leadership training and for the discussion of social, economic and cultural questions

holds annual World Congress (2024: Taoyuan,
Taiwan, in Oct.-Nov.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 200,000 in more than 100 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs JCI News (monthly in English, French and Spanish), Leader Magazine (2 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Latin American and Caribbean Alliance of Young Men's Christian Assoc­iations
org-entry-head.alt-name: La Alianza Latinoamericana y del Caribe de Asociaciones Cristianas de Jóvenes

address.verbatim-address: Avda Ejercito Nacional, 253 1er Piso Col. Anáhuac, Miguel Hidalgo, 11320 Ciudad de México, Mexico

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the holistic devt of young men and women and to strengthen the work of national YMCAs
org-entry.stats: mems: affiliated YMCAs in 25 Latin American and Caribbean countries

address.verbatim-address: 5 rue Amir Abdelkader, 10080 Agdal Riyad, Rabat, Morocco

org-entry.content-note: encourages the participation of African youth in socioeconomic and political devt and democratization
organizes confs and seminars, youth exchanges and youth festivals
relocated from Sudan to Morocco in 2022
org-entry.stats: mems: youth groups in 54 African countries and liberation movements

org-entry.content-note: promotes international fellowship and co-operation among national Round Table groupings aimed at people aged 18-45 years
org-entry.stats: mems: some 2,700 clubs in 65 countries

org-entry.usage: ewyb edio sacac fea sasia ass

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: World Alliance of Young Men's Christian Associations

org-entry.content-note: represents the YMCA movement at global level, strengthens its effectiveness and co-operation between national and regional asscns, advocates on youth issues, co-ordinates YMCA emergency response initiatives
organizes World Council every 4 years (2022: in July, in a hybrid in-person and virtual format, hosted from Aarhus, Denmark; adopted Vision 2030)
org-entry.stats: mems: asscns in 120 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. YMCA World (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: World Youth Complex, Jalan Lebuh Raya, Ayer Keroh, 75450 Melaka, Malaysia

org-entry.content-note: organizes confs, training courses and practical devt projects
has consultative status with ECOSOC
org-entry.stats: mems: 140 orgs
org-entry.content-note: publs WAY Information (every 2 months), Youth Roundup (every 2 months), WAY Forum (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts (WAGGGS)

address.verbatim-address: World Bureau, Olave Centre, 12 c Lyndhurst Rd, London, NW3 5PQ, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: founding aims were to enable girls and young women to develop their full potential as responsible citizens, and to support friendship and mutual understanding worldwide
operates 5 `World Centres’: Pax Lodge (UK), Sangam (India), Cabaña (Mexico), Chalet (Switzerland), and a mobile World Centre in Africa which provides residential training progs
World Conference meets every 3 years
org-entry.stats: mems: about 10m. individuals in 150 orgs
org-entry.content-note: publs Triennial Review , Annual Report , Trefoil Round the World (every 3 years), Our World News (quarterly)
promotes the unity, co-operation, organized action, solidarity and exchange of information and experiences of work and struggle among the progressive youth forces

campaigns against imperialism, fascism, colonialism, exploitation and war and for peace, internationalist solidarity, social progress and youth rights under the slogans `Youth unite!’ and `Forward for lasting peace!’
20th General Assembly held in Nicosia, Cyprus, in Dec. 2019
org-entry.stats: mems: 152 mems in 102 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. World Youth

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: World Organization of the Scout Movement (WOSM)

address.verbatim-address: Suite 3, Level 17, Menara Sentral Vista, 150 Jalan Sultan Abdul Samad Brickfields, 50470 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

org-entry.content-note: works to promote unity and understanding of scouting throughout the world
to develop good citizenship among young people by promoting service, co-operation and leadership
and to provide aid and advice to mems and potential mem. asscns
organizes a World Scout Jamboree every 4 years (26th: Sobieszewska Island, Gdańsk, Poland, in 2027)
the World Scout Bureau (Geneva, Switzerland) has regional offices in Belgium, Egypt, Kenya, Panama, the Philippines, Switzerland and Ukraine
org-entry.stats: mems: 172 national scout orgs in more than 200 countries and territories
org-entry.content-note: publs Triennial Report , WorldScoutInfo

address.verbatim-address: ODC International Plaza Bldg, 219 Salcedo St, Legaspi Village, Makati City 1229, Philippines

org-entry.found-date: 1956 to further the Scout Movement in the Asia-Pacific region by promoting the spirit of brotherhood, unity of purpose, co-operation and mutual assistance among scout orgs within the region
org-entry.content-note: conducts training courses, seminars, workshops, youth forums, jamborees and confs
org-entry.stats: mems: 30m. in Asia-Pacific, 25 scout asscns and 2 assoc. mems
org-entry.content-note: publs Asia-Pacific Scouting Newsletter (monthly), Regional Director’s Report , APRiNBOX (electronic publ.)

address.verbatim-address: Apt 6 b , Rabbi Zeira 3, Jerusalem 93182, Israel

org-entry.content-note: promotes dialogue and co-operation among Jewish univ. students worldwide
organizes an annual Congress
org-entry.stats: mems: 32 nat. unions representing nearly 1m. students
org-entry.content-note: publs The Student Activist Yearbook , WUJS Report

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: World Young Women's Christian Association (World YWCA)

org-entry.content-note: global movement which aims to empower women and girls to change their lives and communities
works to achieve social and economic justice through grass-roots devt and global advocacy
addresses critical issues affecting women, such as HIV and AIDS and violence
promotes the sharing of human and financial resources among mem. asscns
org-entry.stats: mems: 146 asscns
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , Common Concern , Week of Prayer (booklet), other reports

address.verbatim-address: 2021 L St, NW, Suite 101-298, Washington, DC 20036-4914, USA

org-entry.content-note: promotes and supports intercultural exchanges for young people
the global office is comprised of two independently operating structures: YFU International Educational Services and European Educational Exchanges YFU
mems: orgs in more than 55 countries
participatory network of young people committed to promoting human rights and individual dignity
organizes public action, campaigns, seminars, training activities
org-entry.stats: mems: in 30 countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Youth of the European People’s Party (YEPP)

org-entry.found-date: 1997 to unite national youth orgs of mem. parties of European Young Christian Democrats and Democrat Youth Community of Europe
org-entry.content-note: aims to develop contacts between youth movements and advance general political debate among young people
org-entry.stats: mems: 63 orgs in 39 European countries, 3 observers and 4 assoc. mems
